name: Doubletree by Hilton Grand Hotel Biscayne Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a bad stay at the Doubletree. The rooms in the center part of the hotel are old. The carpet was ripped; the towels had holes in them; the room smelled of mildew and carpet fresh. The front desk doesn't answer the phone, and we never got the internet cable they said they would deliver. In December the beach is really busy, but there is no transportation across the bay to the beach. The traffic was so bad that the cab drivers wouldn't take us to Southbeach, but the front desk advised that we drive there and told us where to park. I don't think they have ever been to the beach.
reviews.title: Really Bad

reviews.text: Just returned from a 2 night stay prior to a cruise from Miami. We arrived after a 14hr day with flights from England. Our luggage didn't arrive at Miami as very tight connections. However, hotel lobby staf f dealt with this for us and kept our bags secure until we requested them the following morning.
reviews.title: Fab hotel, great location, great staff!!

likes.liked: — Great views from really spacious room

reviews.text: Hotel superb, we had a bay view room on th 9th floor with stunning views (despite the appalling weather!!) over the bay. Room huge with 2 very comfy beds. Beware of mini bar, as usual very pricey!!
reviews.title: Great location and views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were superb, very accommodating and helpful. The guy on the concierge even got us a complimenary limo to an italian at south beach!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: All in all a fabulous hotel in a great location for a good price (£194 for 2 nights).
reviews.title: when in miami....

likes.disliked: — the inavailability of room we reserved.

reviews.text: I stayed here recently while in Miami on business. My 8th floor “city-view” room was very large, with a king bed, wonderful bathroom, and a large balcony with a water view. There are two sinks (one outside of the shower/toilet room) allowing two to get ready at the same time. The bed was very comfortable and the room – and maybe entire floor – appears to have been recently renovated. There’s a single serve coffee maker, mini-bar (very expensive), and a small microwave. I did not get to try the pool or other facilities. The only problems I encountered were some challenges getting the internet access to work, and the lack of a TV channel guide. Valet only parking is $29/day – if you don’t need a car cabs are always available and a relatively cheap option.
reviews.title: Very nice!

reviews.text: Primos in the lobby is good for a casual meal or quick drink (the calamari appetizer is great!). Or walk two blocks to Biscayne and 18th where you’ll find a nice sushi place and Bin Number 18 – a wonderful, Mediterranean style bistro with an extensive beer and wine list as well as great food (the bruschetta is large enough to be a light meal for one). There’s also a small, very pricy, grocery store and a few other shopping options on the ground floor.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

likes.disliked: — They only give you one cookie.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel one night pre-cruise with my 3 sisters. We had 2 rooms which both overlooked the bay. It was nice to be able to see the cruise ships in the morning. The rooms were clean and well maintained. I would not hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Yuck for rooms, but kudos to staff

reviews.text: The hotel was a great location for a short pre-cruise stay. And I have to say that the staff was excellent, as were were especially high maintenance dealing with lost baggage isues. However, the rooms themselves were awful - just drab, worn, weather beaten looking furniture. It's in an dire need of a makeover.
reviews.title: Excellent bayview rooms and friendly staff.

likes.liked: — Big rooms- bigger than Wynn Tower Suites Room, nice decor IN ROOM, view, and yummy cookies and water are free
likes.disliked: — the hallway to rooms, the behavior of some condo people, a valet problem, and that our room was not cleaned up 100%

reviews.text: DoubleTree Grand Hotel is located in part of a condo building called The Grand. Its location is good if you have a car.
reviews.title: Good Experience

reviews.text: I stayed at the Doubletree "Grand" Hotel on March 28, 2007, on a business trip. It was the worst hotel ever.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a nice rate at hotel website, and any problem to check in or check out. If you have a laptop you can use the wireless for free. Nice pool area, with 4 jacuzzis. Parking is expensive ($24 a day) and you don't have choice at street, so you must use the hotel parking. But overall is a nice place, big room, quiet place. few minutes to miami beach by car.
reviews.title: NICE
No problems, just a great room
reviews.text: I travel over 50% of the time on business, so I have seen a lot of hotel. I booked a junior suite on a Sunday night for one night in August 2007. It was excellent, with a great view of the marina and Miami Beach area. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the room was clean and spacious. The room was a distance down the hall, but not a far as some hotels. I heard no construction. Service was excellent, check in and out a breeze and valet service was quick. The only complaint I had was they have no restaurant of their own and you have to go to one in the nearby mall for breakfast. But my experience was great and I would stay here again.

They have huge staff problems there, check-in takes ages, room-service: no go, and if you have booked the Standard Rooms on Levels 2 to 9 (left site elevators from Lobby) then good luck! there is a huge construction going on just opposite of the hotel. If you want to be there. Just try another hotel
reviews.title: Try another hotel!!

reviews.text: Stayed here (2 nights) with my family (myself, wife, and 2 older teenagers) on our way back from a week at the Ritz Carlton St. Thomas.
reviews.title: For under $150 a good place...

reviews.text: We were originally booked at the Marriott (next door/connected) but they messed up our reservation and suggested we stayed next door at The Grand.
reviews.title: Blah!
